name: AMERICAN AIRLINES, MD-80 First Class: Houston George Bush - DFW
description:

Date of Travel: 16 JULY 2017
Aircraft: McDonnell Douglas MD-82 (SUPER 80)
Tail: N7514A
Livery: American Airlines bare metal "Aquafresh" 
Route: IAH-DFW
Weather on Departure: Scattered clouds, winds calm
Weather on Arrival: Scattered clouds, winds calm 
Airborne Time: 0h58m
Miles: 224
Track: https://flightaware.com/live/flight/AAL2431/history/20170716/1741Z/KIAH/KDFW
Remarks: Probably my last Super 80 flight...

Thanks for finding my video and pressing play! 

My favourite short haul aircraft is the goofy and lovable MD-80. These are being retired fast so I was keen to capture a trip on video. So, instead of taking a direct flight between Houston and Miami, I took a stopover in DFW so I could catch an MD-80. 

Why do I love the MD-80?

1. Super quiet in First Class with the engines a long way behind you!
2. Impressive climb performance. 
3. Nobody else likes them. 
4. They're extremely rare in Europe. 
5. They're very loud if you're outside the aircraft...

Anyway I was glad to capture this. Big thumbs up for American and their new Admirals Club in Houston. A nicely appointed club with good staff and one of the best drinks facilities I've seen in a lounge so far!

Enjoy the video, and thanks for watching. If you subscribe, then thanks for being part of the channel! Don't forget you can follow my travels in realtime on Snapchat!

MY MOST-WATCHED VIDEO - BRITISH AIRWAYS FIRST CLASS 787 REPORT: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LRFyTtxlRg
